intro: Marssonia, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and South Africa. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red, often appearing in clusters. Marssonia species are typically shrubs or small trees, adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. They play an important role in their ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small animals.
